Dear parents/guardians:

I know that this is not the end of the school year that we all expected. It has been a long and stressful last quarter of school. This end of year has brought lots of challenges to both the staff and you as a parent helping your child remain engaged with their schooling at home.

I know many of you are anxious to see what next school year is going to look like. At this point I don’t have a lot of answer for you. What I will tell you is that the administrative staff, board of directors, the co-founders, and myself will be working all summer to ensure that when your child(ren) returns to school they are safe. Your child’s safety is our number one concern and always will be. We will continue to update you of our 2020-2021 school year plans on our website and other social media outlets. If you have questions or concerns we will be at the school most Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays from 8am -1pm. Have a wonderful summer and we are looking forward to the fall!

Sincerely,
Mrs. DeCesare
Director

As many of you may already be aware Governor Mike DeWine has decided to close school buildings for the remainder of the school year. We will continue to serve meals daily from 9am-11am until the last day of school which is May 21st, 2020.

Please continue to check our schools website, Facebook, and Class Dojo for updated information.

Donations
📷
Every year the staff at The Edge Academy and Akros MIddle School donates $20 to be able to wear jeans on Fridays during the school year. The staff picks a charity to donate the money to that is making a difference in the community of Akron. This year the staff decided to donate the funds collected, to Christ Child Charities of Akron. Each year Christ Child Charities of Akron help our families by donating uniforms to students in need. Christ Child provides uniform pants, shirts, and often winter coats to over 15 families each year. The staff collected a total of $700 and the funds raised were matched by Dave Dudas the co-founder of The Edge Academy and Akros Middle School for a total donation of $1,400.

Reading is special you know this is true,

The following table tells you just what to do!

Monday...Fox in Socks...wear crazy or mismatched socks

Tuesday...The Cat in the Hat...wear favorite or crazy hat

Wednesday...The Sneetches and other stories...wear Shirt or accessories with stars

Thursday...If I Ran the Zoo...Shirt with animal print or an animal on it

Friday...Oh the Places You'll Go...Shirt with a location or place on it
ALL ITEMS MUST BE SCHOOL APPROPRIATE. STUDENTS MUST BE COMPLETELY IN DRESS CODE EXCEPT FOR THE ITEM OF THE DAY!!
